info.question: Which of the 5 pillars of the AWS Well Architected Framework uses uses risk assessments and mitigation strategies?
Which of these represent the 5 areas of the security pillar of the AWS Well Architected Framework?
Which of the 5 areas of the security pillar of the AWS Well Architected Framework states 'only authorized and authenticated userscan access your resources in the manner you intend'?

Which of the 5 areas of the security pillar of the AWS Well Architected Framework is described as 'systems and services within your architecture are protected against unintended and unauthorized access'?
Which of the 5 areas of the security pillar of the AWS Well Architected Framework is described as 'used to identify security incidents by using approaches such as capturing and alayzing logs'?
Which of the 5 areas of the security pillar of the AWS Well Architected Framework is described as 'data classification, encryption, protecting data in trasnit and at rest'?
Which of the 5 areas of the security pillar of the AWS Well Architected Framework is described as 'insure architecture is updated to insure timely investigation and recovery'?
Which of these is NOT one of the 5 security design principles?
Which of of the 5 security design principles states 'automate response to anomilies androutine security events'?
Which AWS services can be used to store files?
Which of the following uses AWS edge locations?
Which of the following ia a benefit of Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) over physical servers?
answers: Paying only for what you use
The ability to choose hardware vendors
correctAnswer: Paying only for what you use

info.question: Which AWS service provides infrastructure security optimization recommendations?
answers: AWS Price List Application Programming Interface (API)
Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) Spot Fleet

info.question: Which service allows for the collection and tracking of metrics for AWS services?
A company needs to know which user was responsible for terminating several critical Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) Instances. Where can the customer find this information?
Which service should an administrator use to register a new domain name with AWS?
What is the value of having AWS cloud services accessible through an Application Programming Interface (API)?
answers: Cloud resources can be managed programmatically
AWS infrastructure use will always be cost-optimized
All application testing is managed by AWS
correctAnswer: Cloud resources can be managed programmatically

info.question: Which of the following examples supports the cloud design principle 'design for failure and nothing will fail'?
answers: Adding an elastic load balancer in front of a single Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance
Creating and deploying the most cost-effective solution
Deploying an application in multiple Availability Zones
Using Amazon CloudWatch alerts to monitor performance
correctAnswer: Deploying an application in multiple Availability Zones

info.question: Which service allows an adminstrator to create and modify AWS user permissions?
Which AWS service automates infrastructure provisioning and administartive tasks for an analytical data warehouse?
Which of the following is the resonsibility of the AWS customer acording to the shared security model?
answers: Managing AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
correctAnswer: Managing AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)

info.question: Where can a customer go to get more detail about Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) billing activity that took place 3 months ago?
answers: AWS CloudTrail logs stored in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)

info.question: Who has control over the data in an AWS account?
The main benefit of decoupling an application is to:
answers: Reduce interdependencies so failures do not impact other components
Enable data sychronization across the web application layer
Have the ability to execute automated bootstrping actions
correctAnswer: Reduce interdependencies so failures do not impact other components

info.question: Which of the following is a benefit of running an application across two Availability Zones?
answers: Performance is improved over running in a single Availability Zone
It is more secure than running in a single Availability Zone
It significantly reduces the total cost of ownership versus running in a single Availability Zone
It increases the availability of an application compared to running in a single Availability Zone
correctAnswer: It increases the availability of an application compared to running in a single Availability Zone

info.question: Which of the following security requirements are managed by AWS customers? Select 2 answers from the options given below
Systems applying the cloud architecture principle of elasticity will
answers: Minimize storage requirements by reducing logging and auditing activities
Create systems that scale to the required capacity based on changes in demand
Enable AWS to automatically select the most cost-effective services
Accelerate the design process becaus erecovery from failure is automated, reducing the need for testing
correctAnswer: Create systems that scale to the required capacity based on changes in demand

info.question: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) Spot instances are appropriate for which of the following workloads?
answers: Workloads that are only run in the morning and stopped at night
Workloads where the availability of the Amazon EC2 instances can be flexible
Workloads that need to run for long periods of time without interruption
Workloads that are critical and need Amazon EC2 instances with termination protection
correctAnswer: Workloads where the availability of the Amazon EC2 instances can be flexible

info.question: What AWS feature enables a user to manage services through a web-based user interface?
Which tool can display the distribution of AWS spending?
How can the AWS Management Console be secured against unauthorized access?
Which AWS cloud service is used to turn on Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)?
A disaster recovery strategy on AWS should be based on launching infrastructure in a separate:
Which of the following is a factor when calculating Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) for the AWS cloud?
answers: The number of servers migrated to AWS
The number of users migrated to AWS
The number of passwords migrated to AWS
The number of keys migrated to AWS
correctAnswer: The number of servers migrated to AWS

info.question: Which AWS service is used as a global content delivery network (CDN) service in AWS?
Which of the following is a fully managed NoSQL database service available within AWS?
A company wants to store data that is not frequently accessed. What is the best cost efficient solution that should be considered?
You are currently hosting an infrastructure and most of the EC2 instances are near 90 - 100% utilized. What is the type of EC2 instances you would utilize to ensure the costs are minimized?
What is the ability provided by AWS to enable fast, easy, and secure transfers of files over long distances between your client and your Amazon S3 bucket?
As per the AWS Accetable Use Policy, penetration testing of EC2 instances:
answers: May be performed by AWS, and will be performed by AWS upon customer request
May be performed by AWS, and is periodically performed by AWS
Are expressly prohibited under all circumstances
May be performed by the customer on their own instances with prior authorization from AWS
May be performed by the customer on their own instances, only if performed from EC2 instances
correctAnswer: May be performed by the customer on their own instances with prior authorization from AWS

info.question: The Trusted Advisor service provides insight regarding which four categories of an AWS account?
answers: Security, fault tolerance, high availability, and connectivity
Security, access control, high availability, and performance
Performance, cost optimization, security, and fault tolerance
Performance, cost optimization, access control, and connectivity
correctAnswer: Performance, cost optimization, security, and fault tolerance

info.question: A company is depolying a two-tier, highly available web application to AWS. Which service provides durable storage for the static content while utilizing lower overall CPU resources for the web tier?
What best describes the 'Principle of Least Privilege'?
answers: All users should have the same baselin permissions granted to them to use basic AWS services
Users should be granted permission to access only resources they need to do their assigned job
Users should submit all access requests in writing so that there is a paper trail of who needs access to different AWS resources
Users should always have a little more access granted to them than they need, just in case they end up needed in the future
correctAnswer: Users should be granted permission to access only resources they need to do their assigned job
